tuv.seg: The first thing that a new Dáil does after a general election is to elect a Ceann Comhairle from the members of the Dáil
An chéad rud a dhéantar in aon Dáil nua tar éis olltoghcháin Ceann Comhairle a thogh ó bhaill na Dála
The Ceann Comhairle has the unique role of being the chairperson of the Dáil
Is é/í an Ceann Comhairle Cathaoirleach na Dála
Even though they are a member of a political party, they must act impartially and must try to ensure that all parties and independent members are treated fairly
Cé go mbaineann sé/sí le páirtí polaitiúil ní mór dó/dí a bheith neodrach agus déanamh cinnte de go bhfaigheann chuile pháirtí agus chuile bhall neamhspleách cothrom na féinne in imeachtaí na Dála
You can find information on the the current Ceann Comhairle here
Tá faisnéis faoin gCeann Comhairle reatha ar fáil
Because the Ceann Comhairle cannot actively engage in politics once they are appointed, the Constitution states that they will be automatically re-elected in a general election
Toisc nach nglacann an Ceann Comhairle páirt i bpolaitíocht na Dála ón am go mbíonn sé/sí tofa, deireann an Bunreacht go mbeidh sé/sí tofa gan seasamh mar iarrthóir sa chéad olltoghchán eile
The Ceann Comhairle chairs the proceedings in the house and has a number of important functions;
Is é an Ceann Comhairle an Cathaoirleach ar imeachtaí na Dála. Tá nithe tábhachtacha le déanamh aige/aici:
• Calling on members to speak
• Cuireann sé/sí glaoch chun cainte ar na Baill
All speeches in the Dáil must be directed to the Ceann Comhairle
Caithfidh gach píosa cainte sa Dáil a bheith dírithe ar an gCathaoir
The Ceann Comhairle can put forward a motion for the closure of a debate when they consider that the issue has been adequately discussed
Is féidir leis an gCeann Comhairle rún a chuir síos go bhfuil an t-ábhar pléite agus gur chóir deireadh a chuir leis an díospóireacht ar an ábhar áirithe sin
• Putting questions to the Dáil for voting, supervising the voting and declaring the results
• Ag cuir ceisteanna ós comhair na Dála chun vóta a ghlaoch, ag coimeád súl ar an vótáil agus ag fógairt an toradh
• Keeping proceedings under control and maintaining order in the Dáil
• Ag coiméad smacht ar na himeachtaí agus ag coiméad ord ar obair na Dála
The Ceann Comhairle can order members to leave the Dáil and can recommend that certain members be disciplined by the Dáil

Is féidir leis an gCeann Comhairle iarradh ar dhuine de na baill an Teach a fhágáil muna bhfuil sé/sí ag cloí leis na rialacha agus is féidir leis nó léi moladh a dhéanamh go gcuirtear smacht ar bhaill áirithe den Dáil
If there is great disorder, the Ceann Comhairle can suspend or adjourn the Dáil
Má tá imeachtaí imithe ó smacht sa Dáil is féidir leis an gCeann Comhairle an Dáil a chur ar fionraí nó ar atráth
• Supervising procedure in the Dáil - making sure that motions, amendments and Parliamentary Questions conform to the rules relating to procedure in the Dáil
• Ag déanamh monatóireachta ar imeachtaí na Dála - ag cinntiú go bhfuil na rúin, na leasuithe, na ceisteanna Parlaiminte & rl ag cloí le rialacha módh oibre na Dála
The Ceann Comhairle is the Chairperson of the Committee of Procedure and Privileges, which considers amendment or additions to the Standing Orders
Bíonn an Ceann Comhairle mar Chathaoirleach ar an gCoiste Pribhléidí agus Ord Oibre, a mheasann leasuithe do na Rialacha Seasta
The Standing Orders is a list of rules of procedure that are applied by the Ceann Comhairle
Is iad na Rialacha Seasta na rialacha a bhaineann le hord oibre na Dála a chuireann an Ceann Comhairle i bhfeidhm
• The Ceann Comhairle has the casting vote in any case where there is a tie or equality of votes in the Dáil
• Is ag an gCeann Comhairle atá an vóta réitigh sa chás go mbíonn an uimhir chéanna vótaí ag an dá thaobh de aon rún Dála
